title: Guitar is playing out of tune, and random notes get skipped
body: as title describes. I've uninstalled reinstalled used a seperate account and no change.
author: Brawn001

comments.body: what did you do to fix this?? I'm having the same issue

title: Add Linux usage to README.md
body:
closes #12

tldr it seems to work as long as youre running the executables from within the same Proton/Wine prefix that Steam has setup for WEBFISHING

so i added instructions for how to do that via `protontricks` for the 5 people who are actually playing this game on Linux lol (like myself)
author: foxfirecodes

comments.body: Going to merge this, but I have no way to testing it.

title: Conversion of processed files to MIDI format
body: I love the processor and the included song files, but I prefer direct MIDI input for a player. Is there a way to reconvert the files to MIDI after processing for use in direct MIDI input mods?
author: bigmassivebug

comments.body: Just pushed support for playing directly from .mid files.

title: Update string/fret selection and added refresh button
body:
Updated the string/fret selection logic to prevent skipping notes due to a string being occupied, and improved logic to minimize amount of fret changes required

Also added a refresh button for the song list so users dont need to relaunch the exe every time they add a song into the songs folder
author: aaronfisher-code

comments.body: i really hope this gets merged
Missed this PR amongst other emails that github sent...

title: Guitar Player Produces Random error
body: I entered a midi file and then tried to close and re open guitar player and got this error: Unhandled standard exception of type "class std::system_error" with message "No mapping for the Unicode character exists in the target multi-byte code page."; terminating the application.
author: Bigtree2233

comments.body: Download the most recent release, this should be fixed.

title: Megalovania easter egg?
body: (Assuming I'm not crazy), is it possible to make this a toggle or a config option?
author: gabekao

comments.body: Ask the game developer to remove that...

title: Notes are jumbled and wrong
body:
Playing any of the songs just made a garbled mess out of the notes, and no amount of troubleshooting seemed to do anything about it. I was told it was intended to be used on 1920x1080 fullscreen resolution, but tinkering with that had no results.

I went to the provided discord to seek support, but they weren't able to help.
The person helping me didn't respond for 10 minutes at one point, and then responded to my wondering where they went by explaining that it was because he was working, which I understood and was fine with. I mention this because it then ended with other members of the discord attacking me because they perceived me as being impatient and demanding. Those people mean nothing to me so I'm not bothered, but I certainly won't be using the discord server again.

This is just to submit that there's an issue that prevented the program from working properly. Don't comment on this post. Thank you, and good luck with the program. Happy fishing!
author: ghost

comments.body: You deleted your messages from the discord server.  I was not there at the time, but I strongly get the feeling that you know you were in the wrong.

title: Playback speed ajustment
body:
Firstly, thank you for making something like this! I was wondering how long it would take.
I think it would be useful to be able to control the playback speed of the midis; sometimes the player trips over itself if theres too much happening in a song at once. Being able to adjust it could potentially ease the burden on the player when it needs to swap notes frequently, or just make it a more relaxing vibe to match the pace of the game.
/
author: Crossunite

comments.body: This would be great to have, even a pause button and a progress status would be nice.  I would have to swap from WINAPI to a better GUI framework.  It's something I can work on.
This was just added in v1.1.0

title: Exe's Not there / Wont Launch
body: Hey I may just be stupid, but when trying to launch either program, they just launch projects in Visual Studio Code, trying to build / run, it says it succeeded, but no midis are actually created. Any help is appreciated
author: Wintoli

comments.body: It sounds like you might have downloaded the source code instead of the GuitarPlayer.zip from the Releases page.
God I'm stupid, sorry been a hot sec since using Github. Appreciate it.
